characters: MAN WITH FISH HANGING FROM HIS MOUTH
SCOTT AND BELINDA, ISAAC AND DOROTHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREDITS CONTINUE. In FADED 16mm documentary-style, we see a country road winding through rolling hills. At the top of the hill, a black '57 Cadillac appears and sweeps through the peaceful landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the first time the whole commission was ever gonna meet face to face. Bosses and wiseguys were comin' in from all over the country, and all the New York families, too -- maybe sixty bosses, the whole wiseguy world -- all headin' toward this little town upstate to figure out what's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads, "Entering Apalachin - pop. 342." The black Cadillac speeds past the sign, then another black Caddy, then a black Lincoln, then another Caddy, a Lincoln, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and me, we were goin' up with Tommy D., Fat Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was running the family at the time. Anyway, I don't know what anybody was thinking, but some asshole thought it would be a good idea to have this meeting at Joe Babara's farm in the country where nobody would notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local state police deputy is gassing up his motorcycle when the parade of shiny black cars rolls by. He looks up and scratches his head at the unusual sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out the local cops were watching Joe Babara like a hawk. So now you got about fifty Caddies and Lincolns pullin' into Apalachin and some deputy sheriff with cow shit on his shoes notices all the traffic and calls the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddies and Lincolns are all parked around a rambling country manor. Bosses and wiseguys are meeting and greeting each other on the big front porch. One WISEGUY is trying to shoo a cow away from his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be a ribeye?   Get away from the fuckin' car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal agents start moving in quietly, heavily-armed, wearing big FBI arm bands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting never even got started. The Feds moved in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents with weapons drawn charge the house and start breaking down the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and we moved out. Gangsters in shiny suits are squeezing through windows and leaping off balconies.

dialogues.speaker: WISEGUYS
dialogues.text: fleeing into the surrounding woods and fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your papa and me hid in a field with hay or corn, some kinda foliage, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two wiseguys in suits crouch in the tall grass. Suddenly they see a John Deere harvester bearing down on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then along comes this farmer who almost runs us over in a tractor, so your father hauls out his piece, this .44 cannon he used to carry, and hijacks the goddamn tractor. Funniest fuckin' thing I ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmer goes flying off the harvester and the two wiseguys drive off on it. The farmer looks up to see the John Deere disappear in a swirling cloud of dust that FILLS the SCREEN. END CREDITS.

dialogues.speaker: SWIRLING CLOUD OF CREAM
dialogues.text: on top of an espresso. PULL BACK as a hand reaches in and runs a lemon rind along the rim of the cup. The espresso is picked up and sipped by MANETTA, the aging boss of a prominent New York crime family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is nearly empty. Manetta is talking to PAUL VITTI, a dark, intense, intelligent man in his late forties, and a powerful boss in his own right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Carlo Gambino came out of it capo de tutti capi, and that was the last time the whole commission tried to meet -- until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brooding) I don't know. I don't like it. What do we need a meeting for? Let everybody worry about their own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They finish eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The '57 meeting was about how we were going to divide up the whole country. This meeting is about how we're gonna survive. You got 'made' guys informing for the Feds; bosses going to jail; everybody's dealing drugs; people are getting whacked without permission. And on top of everything, now we got the Chinese Triads and these crazy Russians to deal with. Everything's changing. We need a leader. Someone with fresh ideas. Someone like you. It's gonna be a new century, Paul. We gotta change with the times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna get, a fuckin' web site?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what else happened in 1957, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your father died, I promised him I'd always look out for you. Come to the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They get up to leave. Vitti drops some money on the table. Bodyguards follow them to the door. The waiters and the owner bow to them as they pass. They are almost out the door when Vitti hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. I'm just gonna grab a toothpick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instant he steps back inside, Manetta and his bodyguard are struck by an incredible VOLLEY of GUNFIRE, which BLOWS OUT all the GLASS in the DOOR and WINDOWS. Vitti's bodyguard, JELLY, grabs him and throws him behind the counter, shielding him with his body. Outside, the shooting has stopped and curious bystanders are looking in the broken windows. Vitti's eyes well up with tears.

dialogues.speaker: KLEENEX
dialogues.text: being pulled out of a box. CAROLINE, a woman in her early thirties, dabs at her eyes with the tissue. She's sitting on the couch in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is warm, comfortable, and nicely decorated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weepy) I kept telling him that I needed room to grow and find myself as a person. Not just as a woman but as an independent entity.

dialogues.speaker: BEN SOBOL
dialogues.text: her therapist, seems to be listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I needed to get in touch with my uniqueness, but he couldn't handle that. He said I was driving him away. Do you think I was driving him away, Dr. Sobol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben leans forward sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He's in his mid-forties, has an expressive face and a quick wit, and despite the occasional lapse, he is a gifted and caring psychologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things end, Caroline. That's just a part of life. It's how we deal with things ending that's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe it's over between me and Steve. Maybe there's still hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he did take out a restraining order against you. I have to be honest, that's usually not a good sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Caroline, I think the first thing you have to do... (voice rising) ... is stop whining about this pathetic loser! You're a tragedy queen! (mocking) 'Steve doesn't respect me. Steve doesn't love me anymore.' Who gives a shit! Get a fucking life! You are, without a doubt, the most boring human being I have ever met! Please, say something interesting before I lapse into a goddamn coma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline looks curiously at Ben, unperturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sobol?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Lost in his fantasy, not really listening.    He comes to attention and tries to cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. I was just reflecting on your whole -- situation. It's very interesting what you were just saying. I want you to think about it, and I'm going to think about it, so we'll both think about it and we'll continue next week when I get back from my vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline bursts into tears again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben rushes upstairs and into his bedroom. His 14-year-old son MICHAEL is in his room putting on a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing hurriedly) I know. I couldn't get rid of my last patient. I think she was a tick in a past life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what's Caroline's problem? Your boyfriend's gone, he hates your guts, get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael! What did I tell you? You can't listen to my sessions! It's private stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. I hear you through the vent in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny how that happens when you lie on the floor and put your ear up against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. How's that guy who dreams about shitting trout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering, putting on his tux shirt) Fine. He moved up to striped bass. Put on your cummerbund. Boy, have you grown. Did your mother move next door to a nuclear power plant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling with the cummerbund) Why do we have to wear rented clothes to Grandpa's party? This blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping him) We have to dress up because Grandpa can't have a good time unless everyone else is extremely uncomfortable. (looks at Michael and makes a quick decision) Forget the tux. Regular clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben exits, pulling off the tux shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking off his tux shirt) Are you ambivalent about Grandpa Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from his room) Ambivalent? Where do you get that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) She's not supposed to do that, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother and I, when we got divorced, we agreed we wouldn't put you in the middle, or use you as a go-between to talk about each other. So just do me a favor and tell your mother to shut her big mouth. (comes back into Michael's room) Did she say anything about me getting married again? I think she could be feeling a little anger about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. She really cares. She says you're intimidated by women your own age, and that's why you go for these young babes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fuming) Okay. Listen, for two seconds, pretend I'm not your father. I'm just some guy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna vent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (venting) I hate her! I really hate her! (a beat, then brightly) Okay. Dad again. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Vitti gets out of his car and walks to the warehouse with his most trusted soldier, Jelly, a hulking bruiser, and his sidekick JIMMY, a tightly-wound ferret with chips on both shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they walk) The word is Primo Sindone must have ordered it, but, uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly looks at Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) A lot of people think you set him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would I want to kill Dominic? He was like a father to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you could be the big boss. Everybody figures you're lookin' to wipe out the competition before the big meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that what they figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright with me if you did --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill him! I told you that! Don't you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a room where other Vitti family soldiers, EDDIE COKES, TUNA, and JOHNNY BIGS are waiting. In the middle of the room, a young rat named NICKY SHIVERS is tied to a chair under a strong overhead light. When he speaks, we get a hint of mental incompetence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mr. Vitti, I told 'em I don't know anything but they don't believe me 'cause that one time I said Little Joe hit Dukey and it turned out he didn't but I didn't know because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smacks him) Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky goes suddenly quiet. He watches in terror as Jimmy steps aside and Vitti moves close holding a short length of lead pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, you know me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   You're Mr. Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what I'm gonna do to you if you lie to me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, you're gonna crack me on the head with that pipe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him) It's a rhetorical question, you fuckin' idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only gonna ask you this one time. Who killed Dominic Manetta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (roars) Don't fuckin' lie to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in tears) Honest to God, I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little rat bastard...

dialogues.speaker: 14A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vitti winds up to brain him with the pipe. They all wince in anticipation of the blow. But Vitti just freezes there with his arm upraised. Then he drops his arm and seems to sag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it. He doesn't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the pipe aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks at Jelly in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is driving to the party with Michael. Sitting in stopped traffic, he checks his mirrors anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, urgently) Look at this. Everybody's nuts. Ooh, I hate walking into that house late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're reacting like this because you're mad we have to go to this party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't. I'm not going to be analyzed by someone who up until a few years ago believed in Santa. Sorry, but we only have room for one Dr. Sobol in this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's two Dr. Sobols. There's you and Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Can we talk about something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to read Grandpa's new book? Mom says you won't because you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your mother talk about anything else or is it just me twenty-four hours a day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wham!   Ben REAR-ENDS the CAR in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your mother's fault!   Your mother did that! Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minivan has rear-ended a black Lincoln Town Car. The trunk has sprung open and Nicky Shivers can be seen in the trunk, bound and gagged, kicking and squirming. Muffled shouts can be heard through the duct tape over his mouth. Jelly and Jimmy jump out of the Lincoln and slam the top of the trunk just as Ben gets out of the minivan to inspect the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading Ben off) What's the matter with you?   Are you some kind of moron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   It's totally my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks at the damage. The Lincoln has gotten the worst of it. The rear bumper is hanging off, and Jelly is struggling to latch the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking to my son.   I took my eyes off the road --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget that bullshit.   Did you see anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly steps in to defuse the situation, warning Jimmy off with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, sir. It's our fault for being in front of you like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Well, I should have been watching. Let me give you my insurance information --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.   Forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? It looks like your whole rear end might be screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is reattaching the rear bumper and securing the trunk lid with duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was like that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly menacing) Why?    Fuck the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!   Fuck 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORNS start HONKING behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least take my card. You might look at the damage in the morning and change your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly takes the card and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ph.D.    Psychologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shrink. You talk to a lotta nuts, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hears KICKING from inside the car trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pings and knocks. Cheap gas. Hey, how do those minivans handle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly!   Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks totally confused as Jelly hustles back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's father, at the piano in the spacious, elegant, tastefully-decorated living room, surrounded by adoring guests, playing and singing an exuberant rendition of "You Must Have Been a Beautiful Baby." Isaac is a silver- haired patrician, overloaded with self-esteem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ending the sing- along) All right, neurotics only! Well, you must have been a beautiful ba-a-by, 'cause baby look at you now, thank God for Prozac, baby look at you now!

dialogues.speaker: BEN AND MICHAEL
dialogues.text: standing off to the side talking to Ben's mother DOROTHY. In the corner is a large advertising display featuring Isaac's smiling picture on the front cover of his new book, Tell Me What You Feel, Tell Me What You Want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you're not coming? It's my wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand it's a special day for you, Benny, but your father and I can't just pick up and leave town every time you decide to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time? This is a once-in-a- -- twice-in-a-lifetime thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you're not coming to my wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to be there, but I have three book signings next weekend. I can't piss off these big book stores. If I cancel, they'll stick me down on the bottom shelf. That's how they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's the word on the street. The self-help book business is full of vindictive pricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Ben!   The language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I've been alone for eight years, now I've finally met someone I want to spend the rest of my life with and I would really like you to meet her before we get married. You're going to be her family. I think it's better she knows that up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really hostile tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in) I think I'll go talk to the mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mayor's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only hope.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dorothy exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great. Just great. I've got some very interesting patients -- extremely interesting. Fascinating actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad has a patient who dreams he shits trout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac pulls Ben into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you wasting your time out there in the boondocks? New York City is the Mecca of Madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not sure I could spend my life dealing with people whose biggest crisis is how to fire the maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats a guy with an ass full of flounder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trout! And don't minimize my practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you getting so defensive? This is about your own feelings of inadequacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always turn it back on me. Why do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I think you do that? Go ahead, now you ask me why I think you think I think you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. I want you to think about what I said. And when you're ready to talk to me like a normal person, I'll be at the piano with Regis Philbin. (as he crosses away) Rege!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not singing, Isaac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, ladies and gentlemen, at the piano, Regis Philbin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause and laughter from the guests. Ben grabs a glass of champagne from a passing waiter's tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter) Thomas Wolfe was right. You can't go home again -- because your parents still live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti's men converse quietly while a soldier sweeps the room for bugs. He gives the "all clear" and SALVATORE MASIELLO, the old consigliere, speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manetta family is asking a lot of questions. They think we hit Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLO MANGANO, the burly underboss of the Vitti family, jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Dominic! They were after Paul. (to Vitti) It's a miracle you survived. I thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thank God. All I know is if I didn't have some veal stuck in my teeth, I'd be laying there with Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all about the big meeting. Primo Sindone wants to run the whole show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Primo's a boss. He knows the rules. He couldn't go after Dominic and Paul unless the other families gave their permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to sweat) If they did, we're heading for one big fuckin' war. (having trouble breathing) Talk to Zello and Baldassare. Find out what you can. We got two weeks. If the other New York bosses are against us, I want to know it before I walk into that meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels a stabbing pain in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, Paul? You don't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little choked up here.   I gotta get some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks outside. Jelly follows.     Mangano looks quizzically after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is having trouble breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like shit. This whole thing is like a huge fuckin' headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You havin' one of those mindgrains? Sweating profusely now, Vitti feels another stabbing chest pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is putting on his shirt. He looks considerably better. Jelly is sitting down, tapping his own knee with the little rubber hammer. Nothing moves. DOCTOR SHULMAN, a young cardiology resident, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news, Mr. Evans.   Your heart is just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could it be fine? I've had like eight heart attacks in the last three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, based on everything, I'd say you probably had an anxiety attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anxiety attack. A panic attack. I can give you some Xanax if it happens again soon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing) Look at me. Do I look like a guy who panics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous now) There's nothing -- I mean -- it's a common thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go to medical school? I had a heart attack, you quack bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very scared now) Well, not according to these --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vitti moves toward the Doctor, Jelly instinctively grabs the Doctor from behind and holds him while Vitti wraps the blood pressure cuff around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low and deadly, pumping up the cuff with the squeeze-ball) Listen to me, jerk-off. I had a mild heart attack and now it's over. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor nods vigorously, his eyes bugging out as the pressure around his neck increases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone asks you, you never saw me, and I was never here. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangled) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (to Jelly) Take the chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly releases the Doctor, grabs all the papers and follows Vitti out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti and Jelly come walking out the emergency room exit. Vitti stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly, I need you to do something for me as my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to find me a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just came from the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that kind of doctor.   I need a head doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna change your face like Sonny Black? Don't get his nose though, he looks like a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a plastic surgeon, ya spoostud. Do I have to spell everything out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It saves time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to find me a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. This is like the Psychic Network or something. I just ran into a psychiatrist. Actually he ran into me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he seemed like a smart guy. He had a business card and everything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a card? That's a real fuckin' achievement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need a shrink for anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for me. It's for a friend. This friend is having some problems, so I'm going to ask the shrink some questions and get some answers for my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody can know. If anyone hears I'm talking to a shrink, it could be interpreted the wrong way. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Absolutely. (then) Can I ask you one thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This friend.    Is it me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is with a patient, CARL ANDERSON, a high-strung milquetoast in his late forties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, I'm detecting a pattern here. You seem to settle too easily for things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.    I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, well, there you go. You just did it again. I suggested something and you immediately agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.    I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sometimes people do it because they fear rejection or disapproval, but you can't let that worry you, Carl. And you can't agree with things just for the sake of agreeing. Stand your ground. Don't let people roll over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Jelly enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sobol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me!    I'm in a session here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... You're one of the guys I rear-ended the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo. (to Carl) Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly takes Carl by the elbow and lifts him off the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upsa-daisy.   You got a coat, nutbar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell he is. He's not going anywhere until we're done with his session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly pulls a big roll of bills out of his pocket, removes the rubber band, and peels off a couple of fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carl) I'll give you a hundred bucks to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at the money, then he gives Ben a plaintive look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks back to Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peeling off another bill) A hundred and fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling) Three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pays him) You're not that fuckin' crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes the money, gives Ben the thumbs up and exits. Jelly follows him to the door and waves for someone to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if you're upset about your car, I can understand that. But you don't just barge in here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Vitti steps into the office.    Ben freezes.   Jelly crosses to take Vitti's coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen my picture in the papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    And no.    Sometimes.   Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly, wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly exits. Vitti walks around the room, taking everything in. He picks up the phone and listens. up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sits quickly on the coffee table. He crushes a box of tissues, then moves them out from under his ass. Vitti picks up a stack of CDS and looks through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Bennett, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   He's my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti picks up an autographed baseball bat from Ben's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts up his hands) Mr. Vitti, I tried to give the guy my insurance information, but he wouldn't take it. Seriously, I tried several times because it was all my please don't kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just gonna ask if you liked baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Big Yankee fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti puts the bat down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti. Not that it's your fault, but your friend, he interrupted a patient's session and that's -- not good. I think this is a matter for our insurance companies, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of mine is having a problem and he might have to see a shrink, so I'm going to ask you a couple questions. Do we sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever makes you comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben starts for his chair, but Vitti sits in it first. Ben sits on the couch. Vitti adjusts the cuffs of his shirt, and runs a hand down the crease in his slacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the first thing I gotta know about is privacy. You must hear a lot of weird shit in here. How do I know you won't go testifying -- not testifying -- but, you know, talking about it to somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't discuss a patient with anyone for any reason, unless I know the patient may be a danger to himself. Like if I'm concerned a patient might kill himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not fuckin' likely --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- or kill someone else.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben looks to Vitti for a response.    Vitti stares at him for a long, uncomfortable beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who starts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me why you think you need therapy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need therapy. I'm helping out my friend. You didn't hear me say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are supposed to be so great when it comes to listening. You can't remember what I said two seconds ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you, Doc, I'm not thrilled with the level of service up to this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell me about your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a powerful guy. Never had a problem dealing with things, you know? Now all of a sudden, he's falling apart. He cries for no reason. He's having trouble sleeping. And then he started having these attacks. You know, can't breathe, dizzy, chest pains -- like you think you're gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with all you doctors and the fuckin' panic? Did I say panic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not panic. Dizzy -- breathing -- chest pain attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. So the question is, what can he do to make it stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben decides to go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go out on a limb here. I think your friend is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- you -- you -- you have a gift, my friend. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medication could help, but if you really want to get to the bottom of this, you're going to want to get some kind of therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hedging) With me? Oh, I don't know. I'd have to look at my schedule. I'm very heavily booked right now and I'm going on a short vacation tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really share that information with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this could be good. Just getting that off my chest, I feel better already. It's like a load is off my shoulders. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I really didn't do anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did something. The load? Off. Where is it? Don't know. You're good, Doctor. I'll be in touch. But listen to me. (leaning close, menacing) If I talk to you and it turns me into a fag, I'll kill you. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we define 'fag,' because some feelings may come up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti silences him with a wave of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go fag, you die. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti gives Ben a little pat on the cheek, then turns and exits. Ben is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes out the back door of the house carrying a couple of suitcases. Michael follows behind him with his bags. They cross to the car in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you didn't leave any food in your room. I don't want to come home and find a science fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/9/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.   Hey, Dad? One thing though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go fag, you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael! That's it!      I am sealing that vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so cool, Dad. Was that really Paul Vitti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing the bags in the car) I didn't ask to see his Mafia decoder ring, but yeah, it was him. And you cannot tell anyone he was here. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I take it off the internet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopter SHOT of the hotels fronting the crowded beache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA MacNAMARA, a pretty and charming TV news correspondent, is on the air live, surrounded by her camera crew. Kids are frolicking in the pool, splashing off the water slide behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/9/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So judging from the mob scene around the pool here today, I think you'd have to say that there's nothing 'off' about the 'off-season' in Miami Beach this summer. Now, on a personal note, this is my last report for W.V.B.F. I'm getting married to a wonderful man and moving to New York, so if you're up that way, watch for me on the W.P.I.X. news team. Thanks for everything, Miami. (voice catching slightly) For the last time, this is Laura MacNamara, W.V.B.F. news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a bouquet out from behind her back and tosses it to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's smile abruptly disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crew, all business) I'll do the re-asks, then you guys can just shoot the inserts and pack it up. (looks off) Ben!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura runs to Ben, standing on the sidelines, and embraces him. Michael is there too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him, everyone!    This is the guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crew) Hi, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/9/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she hugs him) Oh, I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you too. Michael, say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little too big) This is Michael? I don't think so. If I remember correctly, Michael was a little boy, and this, this is a great big kid. Hey, you. Tell us what you did with Michael Sobol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Michael look at each other out of the corners of their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Come on. Give me a break. I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was nice, but I'm fourteen so it wasn't -- you know -- age appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles appreciatively) Sorry. Just smack me if I do that again. (hugs him) How are you, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward silent moment, everyone smiling uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, you want to go look at the camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I want to look at the camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/9/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I bet there's all kinds of cool video stuff over there. Why don't you check it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets the hint) Oh, yeah. (to Laura) Is it okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. If you break something, don't worry. I'm out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael crosses to the camera crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he likes me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?   He's crazy about you.   I am too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are? And you still really want to get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if you get tired of me? I know so many couples that were really happy, then they got married and just completely lost interest in each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to be us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want to lose the passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm brimming with passion. I'm up to here with passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/9/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want us to be like animals. You know just screaming and sweating and tearing at each other all the time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweating shouldn't be a problem. The tearing sounds painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND GUY crosses over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Uhh, Laura? You want me to take your mic, or at least turn it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks over at the crew. It's obvious that Michael and the crew have heard this whole exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room service cart with the remains of a sumptuous meal is standing in the hall outside one of the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!   Oh, yes. Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is in bed making love to his mistress, SHEILA, a pretty woman in her late 20s. They're really going at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Oh, yes. (then) Is everything okay, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/9/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking for?   I'm trying to do this here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem -- distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got things on my mind.    Stop talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm sorry. Just relax, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back to lovemaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Were you thinking about your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/21/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I wasn't thinking about my wife. (a long beat) Now I'm thinking about my wife. Goddamn it, Sheila, why can't you keep your mouth shut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely frustrated now, he gets out of bed, leaving her alone and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (small voice) I'm sorry, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Laura are nestled together in bed, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Dr. Sobol. Dr. Sobol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly's head pops up on Ben's side of the bed. Ben wakes up and his eyes go wide. Jelly puts a finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti wants to see you.   I have your robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelp. Rocks. Bubbles. A mermaid swims INTO VIEW and meets up with another mermaid. They do beautiful back flips under the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You no-good little two-bit piece of shit bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/21/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK to see the mermaids through the viewing windows of a large tank behind the bar of the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tacky dive with a tropical motif.    Ben, in his robe, being berated by Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got news for you. I'm still fucked up. Whatever you did the other day, it didn't take. You did nothing for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant) I did nothing? What did you expect? I saw you for five minutes. I don't work miracles, Mr. Vitti. And I'll tell you something else. I don't appreciate it when someone breaks into my hotel room and kidnaps me. I don't go for that. I have a family and a life and a serious practice, and I don't have time for your bullshit! (sheepishly) That got away from me near the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti stares at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't get it up tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped cold) You mean sexually?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean for the big game against Michigan State. Of course sexually!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You flew fifteen hundred miles and dragged me out of bed in the middle of the night because you couldn't get an erection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that prove I'm motivated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/21/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take a pill for that, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's a cheat. You start with the pills, next thing you know you got implants with pumps. I think a hard-on should be gotten legitimately or not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that embroidered on a pillow somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna help me or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this. All right. Has this happened before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead dick thing? Never. Well, one time. Tonight. And another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So twice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the math. Two times. (a beat) There was another time. But it was after a big meal, so, you know, that don't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, being unable to perform three or four times --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five times -- it isn't the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not to you -- look at you -- but if I can't get it up, that makes me less of a man and I can't have that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving closer to Ben) In my business I deal with animals. They may seem dumb to an educated guy like you, but make no mistake about it, Doctor, animals are very cunning. And they sense weakness. Right now I'm an injured animal. It's only a matter of time before one of the lions out there catches the scent. Then I'm dead. That's the way it is. If you don't understand that, then you don't understand the life I live and you don't understand me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have until the end of the week to get strong or they're gonna eat me up. If they don't kill me in the meantime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you and you don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible. I can't do anything that fast. And even if I could, what's my goal here? To make you a happy, well-adjusted gangster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the other day I saw a commercial on television, some kid playing with a couple of puppies. I cried for 45 minutes. Slap a pair of tits on me, I'm a woman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I can't help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're turning me down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti, when I got into family therapy, this was not the family I had in mind. I'm turning you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You with your schmucky little office in your schmucky little house out there in Schmuckville -- you're turning me down? What, so you can spend more time listening to housewives piss and moan about how nobody fucks them right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to cry) You see this? This is what I'm talking about! I'm a dead man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben turns away and starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the tears) You call yourself a doctor? You should be ashamed. A real doctor couldn't turn his back on a person who's suffering!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) All right. (hands him a handkerchief) What happened with your wife tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping away his tears) I wasn't with my wife. I was with my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a girlfriend? We could do two months on that alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you're gonna start moralizing with me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Do you have marriage problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do things with her I can't do with my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you do those things with your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. That's the mouth she kisses my children good night with. What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Have you been under a lot of stress lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like seeing your best friend murdered? Yeah, I got stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, based on what you told me before about your attacks, I'd say that's probably it then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just stress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt if there's anything physically wrong with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening, pointing a finger at Ben) You.   You. You're very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot more to it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right. You're right on the money. I can feel the juices rushing back to my manhood as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't need to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This settles it. You're my shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't treat you, Mr. Vitti. I don't think you're really ready to open up and deal with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to you. The honesty. Nobody -- and I mean nobody -- talks to me like this. I'm ready. Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't hear the word 'no' that often, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear it all the time. Only it's more like, 'No, no, please, no!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relenting) All right. I'm here for two more days. When we get back to New York, I'll treat you exclusively for two weeks. I just need to figure out what to tell my other patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to clear your schedule for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, I'll handle it.   Now can I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti throws his arms around him and kisses him on both cheeks. A look of concern crosses Ben's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/21/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters.    Laura is sitting up in bed, pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? I woke up, you were gone, no note or anything. I've been going out of my mind, Ben. I walked all over the hotel looking for you. I almost called the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen. I'm going to tell you the truth. I had a serious patient emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have patients in Florida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one. He followed me here from New York. I had to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this patient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Vitti! (a beat) Paul Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Oh, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    But don't worry. It's not like   he's a real patient. He's got   this idea in his head that I'm   helping him. It's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to treat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be too scary. You don't want a person like that in your life, believe me. I've covered the mob down here. I've seen what they can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, it's been taken care of. I told him I couldn't see him again. He understood and it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) I was so worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her and holds her tightly, feeling like a jerk for lying to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immigrant garment workers cut and sew fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sindone headquarters. A few of his trusted guys are in attendance: HANDSOME JACK, POTATOES, and MOONY, his consigliere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't figure. We take out Manetta, what does Vitti do? Nothing. Why doesn't he move? PRIMO SINDONE, a vain, pompous Mussolini, is standing on a stool in his underwear, being fitted for a suit by a nervous tailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Primo, he's planning something big. The shit is really gonna come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let it come down. Vitti's a tough guy but a lot of tough guys got fed to the crabs off Red Hook over the years. (looking down at the tailor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been down there a long time. Are you measuring my inseam or contemplating a lifestyle change? Sindone nods for the tailor to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primo?   What about Vitti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti. Vitti. The whole time we were growing up, he was the smart guy; I was the dope. My father was a nickel-and-dime shitheel; his father had it all. Vito Genovese blew it at Apalachin because he forgot to kill Gambino before the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't make the same mistake. I want Paul Vitti dead -- now. You two astronauts think you can handle that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Jack and Potatoes nod their agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Primo.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH FISH HANGING FROM HIS MOUTH
dialogues.text: A killer whale leaps up and takes it from between his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience in the stands applaud as the killer whale splashes back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: 32A LAURA AND MICHAEL
dialogues.text: are clapping.    Ben is clearly bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Come on. Get into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. They jump out of the water, they splash, they eat fish. It's not a real stretch for a whale. If they did a number from West Side Story, then I'd be into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop. (to Michael) We're having fun, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to be real honest. I'm not having as much fun as it looks like I am. I'm pretending, you know, because we have to bond and everything.

dialogues.speaker: 32A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Laura looks at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laura) You've got to admire the openness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tad too excited) Here comes the whale again!

dialogues.speaker: 32B TANK
dialogues.text: The whale leaps high in the air and crashes back down, sending a wall of water flying into the first few rows.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY AND JIMMY
dialogues.text: walking by the tank, get soaked by the huge wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: STANDS
dialogues.text: Ben looks and sees Jelly beckoning him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laura and Michael) I'm hungry. Yeah, I'm going to get a hot dog. Who wants a hot dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll go. You're pretending to have a good time. I don't want to spoil that. Be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben confronts Jelly and Jimmy, who are soaked to the skin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?    Are you guys following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' fifteen-hundred dollar suit. You think the whales piss in that water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think they use the men's room next door at the Burger King. (to Ben) Mr. Vitti wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an employee of Mr. Vitti's. That means you're on call twenty- four hours a day just like the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he and I discussed this. I told him I'd see him when I got got back to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a skavootz. It is what it is. If he needs you sooner, you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not going, and if you bother me again I won't treat him at all. Understand? That's it. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: AQUARIUM VIEWING WINDOW
dialogues.text: Ben plunges into the tank in the middle of a school of sharks. He screams silently underwater and swims desperately for the top. A couple of families watching THROUGH the viewing window laugh and applaud as if it's part of the show.

dialogues.speaker: SANDCASTLE
dialogues.text: An alligator loafer steps down on it. We TILT UP TO a SEVEN-YEAR-OLD BOY with a shovel and pail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, a ten dollar bill falls where the sandcastle was. The Boy's face instantly brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alligator loafer belongs to Jelly. He's walking with Jimmy and other bodyguards who form a loose protective perimeter around Ben and Vitti as they walk along the shore. All the guys are wearing loud Jersey beach outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They threw me in the shark tank, Paul. The shark tank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were trying to make a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, that you're a scary guy? I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a mood, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get that way when a shark tries to chew on my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Okay.   Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to calm down. My girl friend saw me all wet? I told her I fell into a tank with the manatees. I lied to her last night, now this. I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manatees.   That's a funny word. Manatees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're entertained. What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I can tell you really care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had an episode. Not an actual panic attack, but I started panicking a little thinking I might have one. Does that seem weird to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm redefining 'weird' on an hourly basis. What were you thinking about when you started feeling anxious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The usual bullshit. Family problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which family? (referring to bodyguards) This one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, regular family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops) I want you to draw a picture of a house. In the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of house? A warehouse? A whorehouse? My house? What house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you after you do it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vitti bends over and starts drawing in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good. I come to Florida and draw pictures in the sand like a jerkoff.

dialogues.speaker: BENCH
dialogues.text: TINO, a local Miami hitman, is covertly watching Ben and Vitti on the beach. He talks into a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what they're doing. He's talking to some guy. Looks like Vitti is drawing something in the sand... What's he drawing? What am I, Superman? I'm a hundred yards away -- I can't see shit... No way, he's got that fat Jelly with him and his partner, Jimmy Boots. We could take him out with a rifle and a scope, but I don't have any of that shit with me. My scope's in the shop... Nah, it's a warranty item... Hey, don't sweat it. You told me to take care of him, I'll take care of him... Okay, I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON BEACH
dialogues.text: Vitti finishes drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.   You happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people?   You told me to draw a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But usually when people draw a house they draw people. Where are the people who live in your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you see, they'd come out and say hello, but the whole family's in the Witness Protection Program. It's very sad. What the fuck you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, forget the house. I'm going to say some words, and you say the first thing that comes into your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, more games. Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- forgive me for I have sinned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clears his throat) Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti looks out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben can't see his face, but Vitti's eyes are full of tears. He wipes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this? Again with the crying. Let's get out of here. We're being watched. Don't look. There's Feds on the roof of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a criminal. It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI AGENTS STEADMAN, RICCI, and PROVANO CLICK away with long-lens CAMERAS as they watch from the rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the new face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Get somebody down there to see what he drew in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever this guy is, he must be important to the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's Vitti's new consigliere. Put his picture on the wire and see what you come up with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti, Ben and Jelly enter the suite. MARIE, Vitti's wife, and their children, THERESA, 14, ANNA, 10, and ANTHONY, seven, are there. Vitti greets them warmly, suddenly a different man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, the whole crew. (kissing Marie) You all right? Good flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're fine. We're on our way to the pool. Kids, get your stuff. We'll get out of your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. Marie, this is a friend of mine, Ben Sobol. (as they AD LIB greetings) He's -- from the boat. A fishing boat captain. Cuban refugee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his hand) Nice to meet you, Senor Sobol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks to Vitti, then to Marie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Theresa and Anna --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Anna, and the big guy, Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony gives Ben a manly handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Theresa's bikini) Jesus, Theresa, you are not wearing that suit to the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to wear, a one-piece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to wear one of those Arab bathrobes with a veil over your face, is what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, Paul.    We'll be back in time for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, babe.    Hey, Anthony.   Guess what I got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up some tickets) Marlins and the Braves -- right behind home plate, tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, you and me. (hugs him) Have fun at the pool. Stay out of the deep end. And don't swim for a couple hours after you eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses his father and exits with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jelly) Send Jimmy down with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice family.    Cuban fishing boat captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell Marie you're a shrink. She'd worry, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About this? I think she'd be more worried about your career choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep going with the therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the bar, pours himself a drink, and lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, normally a patient wouldn't smoke or drink during a session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing smoke) That's an interesting fact I'll have to remember if I'm ever on 'Jeopardy.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me about your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father. He was a big man in the neighborhood -- very well respected. Everybody loved him, God rest his soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passed away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just like saying 'God rest his soul.' Yeah, he passed away. He died when I was about twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart attack.    Sudden thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you and your father close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close? Yeah, you know, pretty close. I guess we weren't getting along that great right then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hangin'   out in the neighborhood.    I had a borghata -- like a kid   gang -- hooligan shit, nothin'   big. But my father didn't   like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fought about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slapped the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then that night he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did that feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It felt great! How did it feel? (shrugs) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, think about it. Were you angry, were you afraid? Sad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any feelings of guilt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?   I didn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just speculating, but maybe in some way you wanted him to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I want my father to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/24/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you said you were fighting. You were rebelling against his authority. There may have been some unresolved Oedipal conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oedipus was a Greek king who killed his father and married his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Greeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an   instinctual developmental drive.    The young boy wants to replace   his father so he can totally   possess his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying I wanted to fuck my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a primal fantasy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my mother? That is the sickest fucking thing I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Freud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then Freud's a sick fuck, and you are too for bringing it up.

dialogues.speaker: 39A OMITTED
dialogues.text: and 40 ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/24/98                           60/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's family, the MacNamaras, and a few close friends have gathered for the rehearsal dinner. There are three tables in a roped-off section of the restaurant with larg floral centerpieces, a small bar in the corner. The MacNamaras, SCOTT and BELINDA, are standing with Laura, Ben, Michael and a couple of other relatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, isn't this wonderful, all of us finally getting to spend some time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/22/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set for the big day, Ben?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't wait, Scott.    Can I call you 'Scott?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends call me 'Captain.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if tomorrow goes as well as the rehearsal, I'd say it's going to be a beautiful wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thanks for going to all this trouble, and I have to thank you and the Captain for something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Laura) For this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone "ahhs" as Ben gives Laura a peck on the cheek. Michael makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Would you like a drink, because I'm definitely having eight or nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disapproving) Shall we go to the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the woman go to their seats, Scott holds Ben back for private moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, there's a lot I'd like to say to you, but I'm going to skip the big father-in-law speech because I know you've been married before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/22/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, it wasn't considered a marriage. It was like the Korean War -- more of a police action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I served in Korea, son. I don't think you'd be laughing if you'd seen some of the things I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.    Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Sobol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to see Paul and Marie Vitti coming into the room, followed by their kids and a knot of bodyguards Ben's face falls. He rushes over to intercept them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sputtering) Mr. Vitti! How are you? Mrs. Vitti! Honey, it's the Vittis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura glares at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charming) Look at everybody. Everybody's smiling, everybody's happy. Nice. This is Marie, my girls, my boy, then all these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Vitti, this is Laura, my fiancee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense moment.     Ben presses on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is my son Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/22/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
