dialogues.text: Whoa.  He's a bruiser. (to Ben) You're sure this is your kid? You're a pound and a half soaking wet. I've had lobsters bigger than you. (to Michael) You ever want a job, you come talk to me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Paul Vitti. The mobster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. MacNamara -- uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Is that polite? Is it? I'm trying to be nice here. Do I walk up to you and go, 'You're whoever you are. The prick'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti, this is Laura's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Okay, well, sorry. But you should know, there is no mob, and, P.S., I personally have never been convicted of a crime. (to Jelly) We're nine for nine, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti takes an envelope from his jacket pocket and presses it into Laura's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/22/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I heard about the wedding. Here you go. A little something for the bride and groom. God bless. You should live and be well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti, we can't accept this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you can. Now, if you don't mind, I just need to borrow this guy for a couple of minutes, then that's it. I'm out of here. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Then you leave us alone, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I wouldn't do anything to screw up your wedding. (to Ben) I gotta talk to you. Come on. (to group) Have a great night, everybody. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laura) I've just got to talk to him for a sec. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been less okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is yanked away by Jimmy.     Marie stands with Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you eat a lot of fish since your fiance's in the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/22/98                            66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti, Ben and Jelly step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jelly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch that door. And don't listen to what we say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ears are sealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen. I had a really weird dream last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm having one right now. How could you interrupt our party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're very rigid about certain things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me the dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm asleep. I hear a baby crying. I go to the refrigerator, I get a bottle of milk, I take it to the baby, but when I go to give it to him, I see that the milk is black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fuckin' weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Jelly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it mean? And I don't want to hear any more filth about my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/22/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what it means.   What does it mean to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'm paying you for? I say something, you say it right back to me? I could get Jelly to do this for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben starts to walk off the patio and comes face to face with Laura's father, Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. MacNamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben exits. Scott MacNamara stares suspiciously at Vitti, wondering about his connection to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/13/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scott) Why don't you look over that way before I have to bust your fuckin' head open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott looks away, terrified, as Vitti exits past him.

dialogues.speaker: 40C OMITTED
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines brightly on the wedding day.       Guests assembling for the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tino, the hitman, arrives and saunters into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly walks up to one of the bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get something to eat. You want like a sandwich or somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What kinda sandwich isn't too fattening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in about twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator arrives, Jelly gets in and the doors close behind him. ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/13/98

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: The doors open and the Bodyguard turns to look. TWO SHOTS from a PISTOL with a SILENCER strike him in the chest and he falls to the floor dead. Tino steps out and drags the body to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests are seated, Ben and Michael stand with the justice of the peace as Scott walks Laura down the aisle. The harpist is playing and all's right with the world. Scott shakes Ben's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nod your head and smile. Now, you listen to me, goombah. I know what your game is, and you'd better call it quits, because if you and your paisans do anything to hurt my little girl, I'll kill you. Understand? Nod and smile. Scott crosses away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Your father thinks I'm in the Mafia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a stolen pass key, Tino quietly opens the door and enters. He steps into the living room and hears WATER RUNNING in the bathroom. He stealthily approaches the bathroom door and draws his pistol with a silencer on it from under his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti stares at his reflection in the mirror, then starts washing his face. In the mirror we can see the door starting to open behind him, and the long barrel of Tino's pistol through the crack. Vitti blindly gropes for a towel and starts drying his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tino is about to shoot when Jelly comes up behind him, throws one strong arm around his neck in a powerful choke-hold, and grabs Tino's gun-hand with his free hand. Vitti hears the sounds of a scuffle, steps out of the bathroom, and sees Jelly struggling with Tino. Tino gets off a couple of wild SHOTS, but Jelly finally shakes the GUN loose from Tino's hand. Vitti picks up the gun and puts it to Tino's head. Tino shuts his eyes and turns away, expecting the shot, but then Vitti's hand starts to shake and he breaks into a cold sweat. Tino opens his eyes, sees Vitti frozen, and starts fighting with renewed strength. Jelly hangs on, looks at Vitti with concern, then wrestles Tino out onto the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceremony is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If any man here knows why these two people should not be joined in holy matrimony, let him speak now or forever hold his peace. A beat, then a SCREAM is heard from above, then Tino crashes into a buffet table in the b.g. Wedding guests react in horror.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 49 ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98                            71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Jelly are hastily throwing clothes into suitcases. Vitti comes out of the bedroom hurriedly buttoning up his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently, to Jelly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Mikey to take Marie and the kids right to the airport. (to Jimmy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the car, bring it around to the back and wait for me. Ben bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.   I've had it with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? I just saw a man fall seven stories into a platter of poached salmon! That's what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he break anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Everything! They're still picking the capers out of his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, people get depressed, they jump. It's a human tragedy, but it's not my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me it was suicide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jelly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he left a note. Jelly, did they find that note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but they will in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up a slip of paper, pretends to read) 'Life is bullshit. I can't fuckin' take it no more. Tino.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough talking. We got to get out of here. The place is crawling with feds. I'm going back to New York and I suggest you do the same. They're probably onto you too now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onto me? What are you talking about? Being an accessory to murder was not part of our understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why you busting my balls? I didn't kill him. I can't speak for everyone in the room, but -- (he looks at Jelly) The son-of-a-bitch came after me! It was self-defense. Trust me, Doc. In this one, we're the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Laura bursts into the room, still in her wedding dress, but disheveled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught, to Vitti) How could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Another country heard from. (sotto voice to Ben) Get her outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, why don't you wait downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, they're going to throw me off the balcony, too? (to Vitti) I am thirty -- over thirty years old and all my life I have dreamed of walking down the aisle in a beautiful white dress and marrying the man I love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a beautiful dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but it's not about the dress! We were supposed to get married!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm upset! (to Ben) I'm going downstairs to pack, then I'm going to New York and I'm getting married with you or without you. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there. (walks her to the door) Everything's going to be all right. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy now?      You ruined my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think I wanted this? I'm the victim here! I swear, I'm going to kill that son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you know? Do you hear yourself? I knew this would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole thing has been one big disaster from the minute you walked into my office. We're finished! You hear me? I am no longer your doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just 'cause of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course because of this! You don't have even the tiniest shred of human decency. All you know is threats and violence and that's all you'll ever know and I can't be around that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti stares at Ben for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sindone is watching "America's Most Wanted," rooting for the criminals. Moony comes to him looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come I can't get on this show? This is a good show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primo. You got a phone call. It's Paul Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warily) Vitti. (picks up the phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT Vitti and Sindone. Vitti is on the phone, struggling to contain his rage. Ben watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primo, it's Paul Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how's it goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good. Whoever killed Dominic is shooting at me now and I'm having a lot of feelings about it and I'd like to get some kinda --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- closure on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben nods in encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of feelings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel very angry, you know. Very, uh, enraged. Mad. Real mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumbs up from Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why you telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I telling you? Like you had nothing to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever, I just wanted to tell you how I feel because I know that anger is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blocked wish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a blocked wish, and I'm getting my wish unblocked and I'm looking forward to getting some closure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loses it) -- and if you make one more move on me I swear to God I'll cut your fuckin' balls off and shove 'em up your ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaffancul'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti rips the phone cord out of the jack and smashes the phone against the wall. He stands there fuming. Sindone hangs up the phone on his end, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a dictionary and find out what this 'closure' is. If that's what he's hitting us with, I want to know what the hell it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is still fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right up until the shoving the balls. You can't keep doing this! You want to get physical? Take a walk. Get a punching bag. Hit a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti whips out a .9MM AUTOMATIC and EMPTIES the CLIP into a pillow on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your fucking pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 57 ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 7/20/98                           74C

dialogues.speaker: LARGE ITALIANATE FOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Cheeky marble cherubs bathe in the soaring jets and bubbling pools of a large rococo fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Laura and Michael are staring up at the elaborate fountain that now fills the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the Vatican. Ask them if anything's missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, get your bags out of the car, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost as tall as the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael crosses away.    Laura glares at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads the card) He felt bad. It's a wedding gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're not married, so I guess we'll have to send it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't blame me. You didn't want to finish the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect? You think that's what I want to remember on our anniversary? 'Gee, honey, let's go look at the wedding video. There's my parents, there's your parents, and there's the guy who plunged to his death.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to think that's not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Next Saturday. It's all set. I even asked for a room with a low ceiling, just to discourage the jumpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who's going to be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us three, a clergyman, and any family members who've completed their crisis counseling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no guests without necks. Everybody has to have a neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do a neck check at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door opens and Ben, Laura and Michael enter, struggling with the luggage. They freeze. Sitting in the family room are the three FBI agents: Steadman, Ricci and Provano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing his badge) Doctor Sobol, Mrs. Sobol -- I'm Agent Steadman, Agent Ricci, Agent Provano, Federal Bureau of Investigation, O.C.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Obsessive-compulsive disorder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Organized Crime Division. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura recognizes Provano from the hotel and glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI! This is better than the fountain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, go to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I can hear better in there anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael exits. On the coffee table are dozens of pictures of Ben and Paul Vitti taken in Miami and just about everywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) So.   FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you explain these photographs, Doctor Sobol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a psychotherapist.    Paul Vitti is my patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was your patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Was.   That's what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not like a real patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did he send you that fountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a gift to celebrate the completion of his therapy. We got our television from an agoraphobic, so it's not that unusual -- you know, maybe you should discuss this with my attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Sobol, Paul Vitti is an extremely dangerous man. We're talking conspiracy, fraud, extortion, racketeering, grand theft, murder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, but don't forget, the man is a sociopath. You've got to expect that kind of behavior --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks out the window and does a double take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac and Dorothy are standing in the yard, gawking at the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, fellas. My folks are here and I'd like to -- well, die would be my first choice. Can I go out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you didn't remember that when you were breaking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes) Honey, maybe the federal agents would like something to drink? Could you see what we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Agents) I tried, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben rushes up to Isaac and Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!   What a surprise. Ben kisses his mother as she stares at the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That certainly makes a statement. It's a little big for the yard, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I tell you, Mom? It looked much smaller in the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it'll affect your water pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it'll affect the tides. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and I are just very concerned about what happened in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your flight home? Anyone hang themselves in first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got in last night, we couldn't sleep a wink. Is Laura inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but she and Michael are spending some time alone, you know, getting to know each other. That's important. I don't want to disturb that dynamic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're not going to invite us in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) Well, I'm going to wait in the car. There's too much spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy crosses away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. What's with you and Paul Vitti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dad, I'm not at liberty to discuss that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's your patient? Are you joking? Have you thought about what this could do to your reputation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, know, I always wanted to be great, but then I realized that I might have to settle for just being good enough. Now I've got this guy who's hurting and I'm thinking that if I can help this guy, maybe I can be a little bit great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Ben, you're the one who's going to be hurting. I want you to stop seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you read your own book? Instead of trying to run my life, why don't you just close your eyes, take a deep breath, tell me what you feel, tell me what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (with difficulty) I love you -- and I'm afraid for you -- I want you to be safe -- and I want you to have a good life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply touched) Is that really it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I became a shrink? Because I grew up with a great one walking around the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you became a shrink because you were sleeping with your psychology professor at Columbia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes back to Laura and the Agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so you were saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me cut to the chase. Sometime in the next week or so, the heads of every major crime family in the United States are going to meet together somewhere in the New York area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben nods, finally understanding Vitti's two week deadline

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think the stage is set for a major bloodbath. Has he mentioned anything about it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloodbath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. If he said anything about a bloodbath, I probably would've remembered it. Bloodbath is one of those words that, you know, stands out in a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gathering photos) You could really help us out by supplying information about that meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't, I will personally make your life a living hell. I want you to think about that and call me at this number when you change your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean if I change my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tough) Okay. Guess what, fellas? You don't scare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down! (to the Agents) There's going to be a bloodbath. Oh, yeah. Only it's going to be between you and me. You think you can break into our home and intimidate us? That ain't the way it works here, boys. Whatever he and Paul Vitti talked about is privileged. He doesn't have to tell you a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarasoff vs. The University of California. Look it up. Now, if he's done something wrong, take him downtown and book him. Otherwise, I'll ask you very kindly to get the hell out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Laura, that was really --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Oh, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura storms out of the room in a fury. Ben stands, looking miserable, then we hear Michael's voice from the vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is conferring with Sal Masiello, his consigliere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I don't mean this in a disrespectful way. You know I was a good friend to your father and I will always be a good friend to you. But the word is out that you've been talking to a shrink. Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti shoots Jelly a sharp look.      Jelly looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This concerns the whole family. Right now, we're the only ones who know about it, but if it gets out on the street -- what then? Who knows what you've been saying in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of anybody's business what I say in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I beg to differ. If you're doing this to establish some kind of insanity defense later, that's one thing. But everybody's gonna think you're falling apart, and that ain't good. They'll take it as a sign of weakness, and that makes us all vulnerable. Sindone would take over everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to end it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, end it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of this shrink.   He knows too much already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to whack my doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't do it, somebody else will. It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nobody touches him. You hear me? Anybody lays a finger on him, I'll kill 'em. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: 64A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Vitti and Ben are walking down the street.   For some reason, Vitti is wearing a hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to buy some fruit. You want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, go ahead. Ben crosses to a sidewalk fruit stand and starts picking out oranges. Vitti leans up against a car waiting for him to finish. SHOTS are FIRED. He runs toward the car. More SHOTS are FIRED. Ben is hit. Vitti pulls out his gun but he fumbles and drops it. The gunmen run off. Ben sinks to the pavement, mortally wounded. Vitti kneels next to him and sobs loudly. He puts his hand to his head, knocking off his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa!   Papa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben jerks upright in bed, knocked awake by the nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: HOLY WATER FONT
dialogues.text: Someone dips their fingers in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Vitti. He goes down on one knee and genuflects in front of a big crucifix. Ben wiggles his finger in the holy water, just kind of curtsies and waves at Jesus on the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look lousy. You all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Paul, please don't send me any more gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't like the fountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.   It's a boundary issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boundary issue? I say if more people gave from the heart, we'd all be better off. Let's see your watch. (as Ben shows his wrist) Piece of junk. You're getting a Rolex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't buy me a Rolex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about buying it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross to the main aisle of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I really need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stops cold. A casket sits in front of the altar. A funeral service is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Angels. We grew up together. Worked for a crew out of Jersey City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on his way to talk to a federal prosecutor. Got hit by a truck -- twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I need to know that? I'm having nightmares as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral procession comes down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night I dreamed we were walking down the street, I stopped to buy some fruit, and they shot me -- like Brando in The Godfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good scene.    Was I there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mourner walks up to Vitti, bows his head in respect and kisses Vitti on both cheeks. Vitti on both cheeks. Vitti gives him a consoling pat on the shoulder, then the man kisses Ben and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped your gun, then you ran over to me and started yelling, 'Papa, Papa!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was Fredo.    I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older woman kisses Vitti's hand, then both his cheeks. Vitti whispers a few words to her, then she kisses Ben's hand and moves on. More old ladies kiss their hands as they walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're losing it, Doc.   You may need therapy yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man comes up to Vitti, kisses him on both cheeks, embraces him with excessive energy, then repeats the whole scene with Ben and exits. Ben looks at Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him I don't know. Let's get private.

dialogues.speaker: 65A OMITTED
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Vitti come out of the cathedral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? You called me 'Papa.' It's all about your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you, nuts? It was your dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but that's what your black milk dream was about, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. I don't buy it. In my dream, I'm bringing the baby the black milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freud believed you're everyone in your dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that guy I don't need to hear about. I can't even call my mother on the phone after that thing you told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say you are the baby. What kind of milk did you get from your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we stop talking about my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) That's the whole point! We have to start talking about your father. You know what it's like dealing with you? This is you. (imitating Vitti) You gotta help me, Doc. I'm a mess. I'm in pain. (as himself) Okay, Paul, I can help you. (as Vitti) Fuck you. Nobody helps Paul Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Now I'll do you. 'Boo-fuckin'-hoo.' I never said this would be easy. Let's see how you like it. Let's talk about your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of work does he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) That's not important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paused. That means you had a feeling. What does he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, you're fucked up.   Next patient, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running out of time, Paul. Let's not waste it talking about my problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you just said!   You seem upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not upset!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm good at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have three days left. If you want to spend it screwing around, I can't help you. (hailing a taxi) Call me when you're ready to get serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to your father for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab stops at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Jack and Potatoes watch from a vantage point in the park nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could just pop him right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of a church? What are you, a fuckin' animal? It's a holy place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the sidewalk holy, too? I mean, where does the holiness end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) I don't know. Second Avenue?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 68

dialogues.speaker: DIGITAL SOUND MIXER
dialogues.text: in the FBI van. A technician works at the computer console. Steadman listens. Through speakers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to whack my doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't do it, somebody else will. It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nobody touches him. You hear me? Anybody lays a finger on him, I'll kill 'em. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the technician plays an altered version.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to whack my doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't do it, somebody else will. It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I'll kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman shuts off a tape recorder, having just played the altered tape for a stunned Ben and Laura. A long beat, then Ben looks up at the agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is parked at the corner watching the Sobol house as the three FBI agents leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masiello is face to face with Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, he talked to the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this guy. He would never talk to the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly's CELLULAR PHONE RINGS. He steps away and answers it quietly during the following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI was at his house today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth.   I saw 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see. Next thing is he's gonna call you and ask for a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   You don't know this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly covers the phone and turns to Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dr. Sobol. He says he needs to see you right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben waits on a deserted corner in Brooklyn. A black Town Car appears and stops to pick him up. The windows are heavily tinted. Ben takes a deep breath, crosses to the car and opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben finds Jelly sitting in the back seat next to Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit up front with Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) You want me to sit in front? Paul usually sits in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this time you'll sit up front. Why you making a federal case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in the car) Federal case? I'm not making a federal case? Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter pours red wine. Ben is eating out of pure anxiety. Jelly and Jimmy watch him intently. Vitti stares off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prattling nervously) Wow, this is really good. Delicious. I love Italian food. I've never been to Italy but I'd love to go. I've been to France. And Jamaica. That's nice, but I'm sure it's very different from Italy. A whole different, uh -- (silence) So what's everybody doing this summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo Mangano comes to the table. Vitti gets up, hugs and fraternal kisses all around, then Mangano sits down with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ben. He's a friend of mine. (to Ben) Say hello to Carlo Mangano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Carlo was on my father's crew. He's always been like a -- I don't know -- like a cousin to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, that's what I'm saying. It's like a family thing. The closeness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you need, anything I can do for you, Paul, you know. I'm here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. So did you take care of that thing I asked you about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it all right to talk business in front of your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I took care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that other thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for that first thing to come through. I can't move until it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the guy give you a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.    He's a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents monitor the conversation through the bug Ben is wearing. They shake their heads at the incomprehensible dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him you weren't going for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always gotta nip that shit in the bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But if the first thing is okay, that should fix everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including the second thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (to Ben) Don't repeat any of that to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The first thing or the second thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Stevie Beef over there. I gotta go say hello to him for a second. (to Mangano) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben watches Vitti and Mangano cross the room, then turns to Jelly and Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie Beef. Interesting name. When he was younger they probably called him Stevie Veal. (off no response) You guys come here often?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paretti's has a very special meaning to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is where his father got whacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Wait a second. Paul's father was murdered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right at that table.   With his whole family there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, too?   He was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't like to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is suddenly clear to Ben.      He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Jelly enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta -- you know -- poop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben goes into a stall, latches the door and drops his pants. Jelly combs his hair in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hastily unbuttons his shirt, revealing a small microphone taped to his chest. He picks at the edge of the tape, takes a deep breath, then rips it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!

dialogues.speaker: JELLY
dialogues.text: at the urinal, reacts to Ben's cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need more roughage. A bran muffin in the morning would help with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Jelly rejoin Vitti.      Ben starts right in on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you -- in private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jelly and Jimmy) Leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit without hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me about your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he died of a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?   Your father was murdered!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart attack, murdered, what's the difference? He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big difference.   Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's private. You think I tell you every little thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not a little thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you want to know? Analyze this. I was twelve years old, the whole family was having dinner together right over there, two guys walked in and shot him dead right in front of us. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't think this was important enough to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do? Spend the rest of my life crying about the past? Forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I think you want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you choose this restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I like it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/25/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the places we could've gone, why this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White clam sauce. The best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're here because you wanted me to know about your father. You're reaching out to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll reach out to you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti suddenly reaches over and rips Ben's shirt open. All he sees is a bald patch on Ben's chest where the bug was taped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have some major trust issues here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cutting room is deserted except for Primo and his men. Sindone is at his desk reading the entertainment section of the New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the paper) I'd like to see a movie but there's nothing out there. It's all this shoot-'em-up action bullshit. I get enough of that at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.     Moony finishes a call on his cell pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was our friend. He marked your guy at Paretti's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Then let's make it the last supper. Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Primo. (to Potatoes) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/25/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they exit) Hey, Jack. Just for fun, tear out his heart and bring it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti, Ben and the boys come out of the restaurant and walk to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, you can have shotgun this time. I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, sit up front. There's more room for your legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My legs are short, it's fine in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? It's late. I think I'm just going to call it a night. Why don't I just grab a cab and head on home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, it's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls a gun) Get in the fucking car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks to Vitti for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we call this a transference neurosis. It's when the patient starts acting out his problems with his therapist instead of out in the world. It's usually considered a good sign. Not for me, in this case, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy forces him into the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln makes a U-turn in front of Paretti's and drives off down the street passing Handsome Jack and Potatoes in a car parked at the corner. The car takes off after the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents are monitoring the bug, but all they hear is WATER RUNNING and TOILETS FLUSHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing in there? He's been in the bathroom for half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricci and Steadman look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI van pulls up and lurches to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman rushes in, pushes open the stall and sees the microphone and transmitter in the bottom of the toilet bowl.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly's car pulls into a scrap metal yard and parks. They all get out. Jelly hands Vitti a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jimmy and Jelly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone. Jelly looks apologetically at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Doc.    It's not personal, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kid yourself, Jelly. It doesn't get more personal than this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jelly and Jimmy walk away, leaving Ben alone with Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I have to do this, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're a paranoid? No, actually you're a reverse paranoid. You think you're out to get everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me! You betrayed me! You stabbed me in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start shouting at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I betrayed you? What are you talking about? Who's got the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm an idiot? Don't insult my intelligence. You cooperated! You talked to the Feds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They played me a tape! You said you were going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.   I never said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glare at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. I didn't betray you, Paul. Yes, they made me wear a wire, but I took it off, because I think I know how to help you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts the gun to Ben's head) It's over! Don't you get it? I took one chance and that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (as Vitti cocks the gun) Can I ask you one last question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night. What were you eating the night your father got killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was 35 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did your father have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you!   I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a simple question.    What was your father eating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long pause) Penne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.    And you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravioli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food was on the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were just serving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the guys coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them.   Dressed like a busboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your father see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I knew he looked wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pants. They looked too good for a busboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walked over to the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched him the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was so mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were mad at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw the second guy.    My mother started screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you blame yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I coulda saved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were mad at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to hyperventilate) I killed my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't kill him, Paul. You were angry but you didn't kill him. That's the life he chose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never got to say good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it now, Paul. Talk to him. What do you want to tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to.   Tell him, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaks down) I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Paul. You can let go of it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti leans back against the car, slumps to the ground and starts sobbing, 35 years of pent-up grief finally finding expression.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY AND JIMMY
dialogues.text: Standing around smoking, waiting for the death shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking so long?   I'm ruining my goddamn shoes here.   Fuckin' $350 Bruno Maglis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? Don't you have any respect? This is a very difficult thing for Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda let me do it. I'd be home watchin' E.S.P.N.2 by now. World's strongest man. You should see these guys.

dialogues.speaker: VITTI AND BEN
dialogues.text: Ben is comforting Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't save him, Paul. He was trying to save you. That's what you fought about. He didn't want this for you, and you don't want it for Anthony. You don't want him to grow up the way you did -- without a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti just cries louder.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY AND JIMMY
dialogues.text: hearing the crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, the guy's fallin' apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why doesn't he just pop him?   It's embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANALYZE THIS - Rev. 6/10/98                            10

dialogues.speaker: BEN AND VITTI
dialogues.text: Ben tries to comfort Vitti who is still crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's not dead, Paul. He's alive -- in you. And he's trying to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there is a GUNSHOT and a BULLET RICOCHETS off the TOP of the CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME JACK
dialogues.text: He OPENS UP with a MAC-10.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY AND JIMMY
dialogues.text: Jimmy goes down, hit in the shoulder.      Jelly dives fo cover behind a rusted car body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a panic) Paul!   They're shooting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti continues to sob, oblivious to the GUN BATTLE raging around him.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY
dialogues.text: He FIRES back at Handsome Jack.

dialogues.speaker: POTATOES
dialogues.text: He rakes the Lincoln with a BURST from the ASSAULT RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY'S CAR
dialogues.text: All the WINDOWS ARE BLOWN OUT by the GUNFIRE.     Ben screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! For God's sake, shoot somebody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti just sits there on the ground, still sobbing quietly.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY
dialogues.text: He reloads and FIRES again.

dialogues.speaker: POTATOES
dialogues.text: Jelly's last SHOT strikes him right in the chest, and he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME JACK
dialogues.text: He sees Potatoes fall and starts moving out, covering his retreat with another BURST from his MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY'S CAR
dialogues.text: Something snaps inside Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the GUN out of Vitti's hand and starts FIRING WILDLY.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY
dialogues.text: He sees Handsome Jack emerge from cover and takes him out with FIVE QUICK SHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME JACK
dialogues.text: He goes down FIRING, dead before he hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP YARD
dialogues.text: It's suddenly quiet. After a long moment, Jimmy rolls over and moans. Jelly goes to him and starts examining his wound.

dialogues.speaker: JELLY'S CAR
dialogues.text: Ben stands up, still holding Vitti's gun.    He sees Handsome Jack lying dead on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!    Did I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Doc. That one's mine. You got the Chevy Camaro and the side-by-side refrigerator-freezer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vitti emerges from behind the car looking red-eyed but composed again and looks at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty fuckin' ironic, isn't it? You can give me back the gun now, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti holds out his hand.      Ben hesitates for a moment then hands him the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I wasn't really gonna whack you. (off Jelly's skeptical look) All right, maybe I was gonna whack you, but I was real conflicted about it. Progress, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can see you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was big tonight. You might feel a little raw for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So good luck.    It's been --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti nods, they stand there for another moment, then Ben walks off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE, a fortyish, tired-looking wife and mother sits on the couch across from Ben. Ben looks bored and depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to please him in bed, but whatever I do it seems like it's never enough. Now he wants me to say things when we're making love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinds of things does he want you to say, Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he wants me to call him 'big boy.' And he's my bucking bronco, and I'm supposed to ride him hard and put him back in the barn wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's laughter is heard coming through the vent. closes his eyes and sighs deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Dr. Sobol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me suggest something, Elaine. If the man wants you to say things ... damn it, you should get down on all fours and bark like a dog if that's going to get the job done. Break out the wine, baby. Smoke a joint. Do what you have to do, because life is too short. It's just too fucking short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine stares, taken aback, then she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly, Jimmy and Iron Mike arrive and walk up to the house. The rest of the crew are standing around on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly enters and finds Vitti in his undershorts, putting on his tie, looking very strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feelin', boss?   You need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm great. Never felt better in my life. When this meeting is over they won't know what hit 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly gives him the thumbs up and exits. Vitti turns to the TV and starts knotting his tie as a PRUDENTIAL INSURANCE COMMERCIAL STARTS PLAYING, featuring a father and his son. As Vitti watches the sentimental ad, his eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is shining. A beautiful day for a wedding. "HERE COMES THE BRIDE" is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd oohs and aahs as Laura starts down the aisle in her wedding dress. Isaac and Dorothy are standing near the chupah ready to receive her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Ben going to step on the glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He doesn't want to hurt his foot, so they're going to drop a person on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and Ben stand before a REFORMED RABBI. The family is gathered again. Michael stands just to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are put on this earth to find a love, a soulmate, someone with whom we can create joy. How glad we are today that Ben and Laura have found each other, and we anticipate and celebrate the years of joy they will share together from this day on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a PSST from somewhere.    Ben and Laura don't see to notice it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, do you take this woman, Laura, to be your lawfully wedded wife, for richer, for poorer, in sickness and in health, 'til death do you part, so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another PSST. Ben looks over and sees Jelly standing behind some flowers to the side of the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not you.    I was talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not important.     Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes to the thing before. To her. That's a yes. Pick it up from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly moves closer.       The guests start to mutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Doc, we're going to need to hurry it up here. (to Michael) Hi, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not believe this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Rabbi) Haul ass, buddy. We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Ooh, she's feisty. Watch out, Doc. (to the Rabbi) Tick tock, let's go. Hurry up and pronounce them, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the power vested me by the state of New York, I now pronounce you man and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Kiss, kiss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Laura kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about this, Mrs. Sobol, but duty calls, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) Oh. You're the first person to call me Mrs. Sobol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura, I'm sorry. It's the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.  Just go. (to Jelly) Have him back here by the salad course or you're in serious trouble. Capiche?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pistol. (to Ben) I like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben kisses Laura, then the organist plays "Here Comes the Bride" as Jelly and Ben hurry down the aisle together.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT AND BELINDA, ISAAC AND DOROTHY
dialogues.text: shaking their heads in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes out of the function room with Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bad, Doc. Worse than I ever seen him. I think his inner child is all fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen an episode like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Once on 'Bonanza,' Hoss Cartwright got bit by a raccoon. He got this fever and he was shaking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly and Ben come out of the hotel into the garage area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is serious, Doc. If he doesn't make this meeting, they'll kill him for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't someone else in the family go for him? Tommy the Tongue? Louie the Lip? What about you? You go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would work except for one little detail. I'm a fucking moron. I'm known for it. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   You must be a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Watch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's different when I say it. When you say it, it sounds very negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jelly, but I'm not going. I'm not on the payroll anymore, so forget about it. My wife is waiting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go back into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben feels a gun pressed against his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't shoot me, Jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correction. Mr. Vitti couldn't shoot you. But here's something about me you should know. I never got married, Doctor Sobol. I don't have a hobby. I never got a dog or a cat. I don't even have a goldfish. I live for one reason only, and that's to serve Mr. Paul Vitti. He's what I'm thinking about when I wake up, and he's what I'm thinking about when I close my eyes to sleep. If he told me to jump off a tall building, not only would I do it, I would hope to survive so I could do it again and again until he told me to stop. This is all I know. This is all I got. So please don't think I won't kill you, because I'd hate for your last thought to be a wrong one. You're going to that meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked on 50th Street, Ricci and another agent watch the limo emerge from the Waldorf garage. Ricci signals someone on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: 100C FBI HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: flies INTO VIEW over Park Avenue and starts tracking the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black stretch limo approaches the tunnel entrance. An FBI helicopter zooms INTO VIEW high above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman and Provano track the limo from the air as it enters the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen identical limos emerge from the tunnel on the Queens side and start criss-crossing as they leave the toll booths, then head off in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman and Provo try to pick Ben's limo out of the pack of identical limos heading up the Long Island Expressway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is in the back with Jelly and Jimmy. One of their crew, IRON MIKE, is driving. Ben is putting on a suit of Jimmy's. He looks very anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his shoulder bandaged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember. That's a fuckin' $1200 Valentino suit. You spill anything on it, I'll mess you up good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. You're making him nervous. If he gets nervous and fucks up, they'll kill him for sure. (to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go over it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti's been detained, apologies all around, blah, blah, blah. Then you say you're the new consigliere, and you're prepared to speak for Mr. Vitti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you just keep your mouth shut, and hope nobody asks you nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, this is some fuckin' plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have to talk, just be vague. Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a psychologist.   Believe me, I can be vague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti is lying on the bed staring at the ceiling. Marie is stroking his forehead. Then he looks over and sees Anthony sitting in a chair at the foot of the bed, watching him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be outside playing or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you gonna sit there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you gonna lay there? Vitti smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls into the parking lot of the Tops Limousine Service. Fifty other limos are already parked there. Jelly and Jimmy get out, followed by Ben, now dressed in shiny suit and pinky ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Jelly, and Jimmy enter a garage the size of a small airplane hangar. The floor has been cleared and long tables set up to form a square in the middle of the room. Wiseguys with shotguns patrol the catwalks above the floo and soldiers are posted at all the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. I'm telling you, I cannot do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking whine! Whining's a dead giveaway. Come on! You're the consigliere, for Chrissake.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Around the tables sit forty or fifty of the biggest gangsters in the world. A few captains stand around the perimeter, ready to serve their bosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the bosses? That one looks like my Uncle Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly steers Ben to an empty seat next to Carlo Mangano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) What's goin' on? Where's Vitti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his way.   Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangano eyes Ben with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's -- it's okay. Forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it? What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated directly across the room from Ben is Primo Sindone. He stares hard at Ben, trying to place him, then leans over to Moony, his consigliere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the guy with Jelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks away nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jelly, borderline hysterical) I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to get up but Jelly pulls him back down. Moony stands up and gets everyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, gentlemen. I think we better start. We have a big agenda, so for now let's stick to the big issues. And it would help if you identify yourselves when you speak, since we don't all know each other, and we didn't think anybody would be into wearing any fucking name tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter around the table. Sindone stands up and looks straight at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Primo Sindone. They call me Sonny Long. It's good to see so many of the old faces here, and to welcome the new ones from all over the country. I see Frank Zello, and Joe Baldassare, but I'm a little disappointed to see that the head of our other New York family isn't here today. All I see is his man Jelly and some sawed-off little prick nobody knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly looks at Ben, waiting for him to speak, but Ben just sits, frozen, looking down at his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands up, rattled) Yeah, well, the thing is Mr. Vitti has been detained and he sends his apologies for -- being detained -- and he apologizes for his -- detainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detained? What kind of bullshit is that? What's more important than this? As the host of this meeting, I take his not being here as a sign of disrespect to me and to all these other men, too, who came a long way to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vitti meant no disrespect. The thing is, he's not feeling well. He's sick and he -- didn't feel well --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben rises and slaps Jelly hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Jelly! We don't ever discuss Mr. Vitti's health outside the family. You know better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly is stunned.    The bosses murmur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, who is this guy and what the fuck is he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In answer to your first question, my name is Ben Sobol -- (off Sindone's look) -- leone. Sobboleone. They call me -- 'The doctor.' As for your second question. I'm here representing Paul Vitti. As his conser -- conghili --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompting) Consigliere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him again) Don't you ever correct me again! As his consigliere, I'm intimately involved in all aspects of the family business and I'm prepared to speak for Mr. Vitti on all matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Doctor, then let's get down to business. Everybody knows there's been this thing between me and Paul Vitti for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which thing are you talking about? The first thing or the second thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What second thing? I only know one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't see how we can discuss the first thing without bringing up the second thing. Didn't you talk to the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tugs meaningfully on his earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy with the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What thing? What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know? You brought it up. (gestures helplessly to the others) This is the whole problem. You can't have an intelligent conversation with the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if I just break your fuckin' neck? What do you think of that?
