dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not important what I think. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I think? I think it's a good idea! Why would I say it if I didn't think it was good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.    Why would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I wouldn't! That's what I'm saying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you always had a problem dealing with your anger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I'm talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) I don't know what the fuck you're talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, you're angry again. Do you feel you have to get angry to be heard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sindone turns to a couple of other bosses, FRANK ZELLO and JOE BALDASSARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But you do have a tendency to get angry a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree, Primo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to talk about Vitti! Why are we talking about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. Do you feel you're not worthy enough to be talked about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primo, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down? How can I calm down when this prick won't stop with the questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you pass the fruit, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!   You're a dead man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sindone whips out a pistol and points it at Ben, but just as he's about to shoot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL VITTI
dialogues.text: He's standing there, staring at Sindone, cool, clear, and unafraid. He looks like a king. The room goes silent. Vitti looks around the table, nods, and crosses to Ben. Jelly gets up to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Jelly) Wait outside with the car running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly nods and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving your ass. Sit down.    I'll take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sits, greatly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group) I'm Paul Vitti. I'm sorry I was late. Those of you who know me will know I meant no disrespect. If it's all right with you, there's something I'd like to say, then I'll leave you to your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks at Vitti and sees a kind of serenity and clarity he's never seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About two and a half weeks ago, somebody killed my friend, Dominic Manetta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks straight at Sindone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. Everybody knows you whacked him so you could take over everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I really came here to say is that I've come to a very important decision in my life. I want out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great murmur of surprise sweeps around the room.      B looks at him proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going away for a while, but I will respect the oath I took the day I was made, and whatever I know about anyone else's business, I take with me to the grave. You have my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A negative buzz among the bosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for my own organization, I know Carlo Mangano would like to be the new boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangano smiles gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why he betrayed Dominic and me to our enemies and sent his own man to kill me in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangano is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I leave it to my people to deal with that and choose their own boss. And even though it's my right, I won't take revenge, mostly because I'm in a good place mentally and feeling good about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed) I don't know, Paul. I can see where some people might have a problem with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that, so as an extra token of good faith between us, I've taken the liberty of writing down everything I know and putting it in a safe deposit box in case anything happens to me or my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long tense silence while the other bosses consider all this. Then, finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what anybody else thinks, but I say good luck and God bless, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Paul. Salut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all raise their glasses and toast Vitti.     Ben rai his glass to Vitti and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vitti) Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti smiles at him and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Vitti come out of the building and cross to the car. Jelly is waiting, Iron Mike has the MOTOR RUNNING, and Jimmy is in the front seat with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sindone and Mangano come out with guns drawn, flanked by two wise guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitti!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vitti and his crew turn and face Sindone and Mangano across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this, Primo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to do this? That's fuckin' rich. What did you think, you could just quit and walk away? You think this is a fuckin' civil service job? What are you, crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. (to Mangano) Hey, Carlo, tell me. You gonna stab me in the back like the piece of shit I always knew you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangano stares at him, cold and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna stab you in the back, Paul. I want to see your face when I do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. (calls out) Mo-Mo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo-Mo stands up from behind a car pointing a shotgun at Mangano and Sindone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bigs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Bigs steps out from behind a shed holding an assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of a van opens to reveal Eddie "Cokes" and Tuna manning a military air-cooled machine gun on a tripod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Primo. Now get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sindone glares at him, then lowers his gun, turns, and starts to walk back into the building joined by Mangano and the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vitti and Ben relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking. I was going to bring a machine gun but I don't have one. Of course, we haven't opened the wedding gifts yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Sindone whirls and FIRES at Vitti. Ben staggers in front of Vitti and takes the bullet in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assembled bosses hear the sound of GUNFIRE outside. Zello looks at Baldassare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bosses all jump up and run for the exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the GUN BATTLE CONTINUES, Sindone jumps into a car and tries to escape, but Eddie Cokes RIPS his car with the MACHINE GUN, stopping it dead.

dialogues.speaker: 113A GATES
dialogues.text: An NYPD armored assault vehicle bursts through the gates. Police cruisers and SWAT vans come racing up to the scene SIRENS SHRIEKING. Then, from out of the sky, the FBI helicopter descends, blaring a warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a loudspeaker) Drop your weapons and lie facedown on the ground. I repeat. Drop your weapons and lie facedown on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosses and fat capos go running through the alleys and clambering over fences in their silk suits and expensive loafers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Ricci, wearing a flak jacket and FBI baseball cap, has Sindone down on the ground with his foot on Primo's neck and a .45 aimed at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! Don't you fucking move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Take a pill, Robocop. Vitti is tending to Ben who is on the ground leaning against the side of the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply moved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it. You took a bullet for me. What doctor ever did that much for a patient? I'll never forget that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul -- I tripped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You tripped over your unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful summer day. Convicts are playing basketball and lounging in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben in a sport coat, and Vitti, in prison whites, are sitting around in a circle with several other convicts. DONNY, a heavyweight con with a shaved head and numerous tattoos is talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think my mother really listens when I talk. She never listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how does that make you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me feel angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you feel hurt, too, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly vulnerable) Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, what would you say about what Donny's feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny, when you're thirsty, you don't go to the wall -- you go to the well. You know what I'm saying? Your mother may never be able to listen to you, but you have friends here who will. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is proud of Vitti's new sensitivity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be patient, Donny. Most people's problems take months, sometimes years to resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing twenty-five to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should be plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Vitti have just left the therapy group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know they found Primo Sindone dead in a field near LaGuardia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. (off Ben's look) I had nothing to do with it. There were guys lined up from Canarsie to Atlantic City who wanted to whack that bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Doc, I don't think I ever thanked you properly for curing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't say 'cured.' We say you had a 'corrective emotional experience.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, you, you're very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) No.   You. You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Laura are dancing in the yard. Paper lanterns are hung here and there. A bottle of champagne sits open on the table. A great TONY BENNETT SONG can be heard playing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been three weeks since the last time you were kidnapped. I don't know if I can adjust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss as the SONG ENDS.    Ben turns and speaks to someone O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Tony?   One more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY BENNETT and his trio are set up on the back porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want, Dr. Sobol. My friend told me to stay as long as you wanted me. What do you want to hear, Mrs. Sobol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your choice, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd say that. (quietly, to trio) 'World on a String,' fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony sings "I've Got the World on a String" as Ben and Laura continue to dance. The CAMERA PANS UP and we see Michael smiling and shooting video from his bedroom window, then the CAMERA PANS UP TO a starry sky, and we..
